Ad Text:
Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.

Life at SEEK

SEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Places to Work in Technology (2021-2024). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.

Job Description

About the Team
Hirer Channels manages the products that enable hirers to access SEEK, through our web and mobile experiences, as well as via ATS integrations and APIs. Our remit includes acquiring new hirers, supporting their job-posting and job-management workflows, helping them manage their brand and content, and providing seamless payment experiences. We operate across eight markets and comprise eight high-performing, mission-driven, cross-regional teams.
Each team sets quarterly OKRs and owns its products end-to-end. Our stakeholder landscape is broad, with close partnerships across SEEK, including Customer Service, Sales, Marketing, Finance, Data Science, Platform  Services and Data Services.

About the role
We’re hiring a Principal Business Analyst to lead analysis on complex, high‑value initiatives across multiple teams. You’ll combine deep technical understanding with exceptional stakeholder management to shape solutions, drive outcomes, and role‑model BA excellence. This is a craft leadership role focused on technical leadership and delivery, not line management.

What you’ll do

Build trusted relationships and influence senior stakeholders across Product, Engineering, and cross‑functional teams.
Lead discovery, requirements, prioritisation, and solution design for complex initiatives end‑to‑end.
Drive iteration planning, backlog refinement, and delivery across multiple teams; manage dependencies and risks.
Facilitate workshops, clarify scope, and ensure traceability to business outcomes.
Provide technical guidance on process modelling, testing/QA standards, and change management.
Mentor and coach BAs; foster knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
Partner with third‑party vendors as needed; support recruitment and onboarding.

What you’ll bring

Strong technical understanding; able to translate complex systems and architectures into clear business outcomes.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication; lead through influence and mentor others.
High judgment in ambiguity; comfortable owning outcomes across multi‑team programs.
Mastery of BA practices: discovery, scoping, requirements, facilitation, analysis, and delivery oversight.
Proven experience coordinating large programs and managing dependencies, risks, and change.
Proficient in Agile practices and tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence); strong data‑driven analysis skills (e.g., SQL); business process modelling expertise.
Local candidate with existing work rights.
Qualifications

Nice to have

Experience with project/program management principles and enterprise‑level initiatives.
Background in online marketplaces.
Prior experience in Software Engineering/Development, IT Service Management, or Iteration Management.
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline.
Additional Information

Perks and benefits
At SEEK we offer:

Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Support for parents with 14 weeks paid primary carers leave and 2 weeks paid leave for partners
Casual dress – every day

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Job Title: Technical (Data) Business Analyst - Contract - 6 months - Brisbane
Ad Text:
Our client  is seeking a Technical Business Analyst to support their ongoing Data Modernisation projects on a 6 Month Contract - starting in January 2026  This role offers an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of business and technology, ensuring solutions meet the evolving needs of the organisation.

Location: Brisbane, Australia
Type: Contract

Role Overview

We are seeking a Technical Business Analyst to support the migration of on-prem SQL databases to Microsoft Azure. This role sits at the intersection of data engineering, cloud platforms, and business stakeholders, translating complex data and platform requirements into clear, actionable delivery outcomes.

This is a hands-on, technical BA role.

Key Responsibilities

Elicit, analyse, and document functional and non-functional requirements for migrating SQL databases to Azure.

Work with architects and engineers on solutions leveraging:

Azure SQL / Azure Synapse

Azure Data Factory (ADF) for data ingestion and orchestration

Databricks for data transformation and analytics

Translate business and data requirements into:

Data models

Source-to-target mappings

Pipeline and transformation logic

Support Azure DevOps:

Backlog management

User stories, acceptance criteria

Sprint planning and delivery tracking

Lead and coordinate UAT activities:

Define UAT scope, scenarios, and test cases

Support defect triage and resolution

Validate data accuracy, reconciliation, and quality

Act as the bridge between business users, data teams, and cloud engineers, ensuring alignment on outcomes and constraints.

Required Skills & Experience

Strong experience as a Technical Business Analyst in data-centric environments.

Proven experience working on cloud data migrations, ideally from on-prem SQL to Microsoft Azure.

Solid understanding of:

SQL databases (querying, schema, performance concepts)

Azure Data Factory

Databricks

Azure DevOps

Experience documenting:

Data flows

Data transformations

Integration and interface specifications

Hands-on involvement in UAT planning and execution.

Strong stakeholder management across technical and non-technical audiences.

Please only apply if you are able to do 3 days on site in Brisbane each week and able to start either the first week in January 2026 or the latest 12th January.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
We're seeking a highly skilled Senior Power BI Specialist for this well known utilities organisation to deliver impactful, customer-focused analytics using modern Azure data platforms.

In this hands-on, business-facing role, you'll work closely with teams across Enterprise Data & Analytics, Customer Technology, and Retail Services to transform complex customer and billing data into intuitive dashboards and insights that drive better decision-making and service outcomes.

Key activities

Design, build, and maintain robust Power BI semantic models, leveraging DAX and Power Query, and integrating data from Azure Databricks in line with best-practice data governance and coding standards.
Deliver intuitive, high-impact Power BI dashboards that enable self-service analytics and faster, more confident data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with stakeholders across IT, Asset Services, business units, and external vendors to understand reporting needs and drive strong adoption of analytics solutions.
Translate business requirements into scalable, reusable, and well-governed data solutions.

Skills and experience

Extensive experience as a Senior Power BI Specialist or Reporting Analyst in a complex, enterprise environment.
Deep expertise in Power BI, DAX, Power Query, and dimensional data modelling.
Strong experience working with Azure data services, particularly Azure Databricks.
Proven ability to engage confidently with business stakeholders and translate complex requirements into clear, actionable insights.
A collaborative mindset, excellent communication skills, and a passion for customer-focused reporting.

Apply now to secure an interview or email josh.dmonte@talentinternational for further information.

Strategy Lead – Energy Sector

A leader in the energy sector is seeking a Strategy Lead to support the Head of Strategy develop the strategic agenda. In this role, you will be responsible for deep dives and high-quality analysis, creating recommendations to inform the direction of the business. You will be  a trusted advisor to the leadership team and beyond.

Key Responsibilities:

Support development and execution of strategic agendas this role will play an important role in shaping the overall strategy and ensuring it is aligned with broader organizational objectives.
Conduct rigorous research and analysis to provide quantitative and qualitative assessment of risks and opportunities.
Drive the implementation of targeted initiatives to ensure the efficient and successful execution of strategic plans.
Identify and manage rapid responses to emerging issues that may impact the business’s ability to achieve its strategic goals and targets.
Provide key input for leadership reports and decision-making forums, including preparing papers for the Board and Executive Leadership Team.
Collaborate with stakeholders across various levels to support strategic planning, simplify complex topics, and enhance prioritization and focus.
Build and maintain relationships with key internal teams, including other Corporate Strategy teams , Finance, and Capital Investment, to ensure alignment and cooperation across functions.
Contribute to regulatory and policy advocacy, customer strategy, and business improvement initiatives that support the overall objectives of the business.
Offer strategic insights and reporting on both internal and external developments that influence the organization’s business strategy, providing clarity and direction for leadership and stakeholders.
  
Key Requirements:

3+ years of experience in a strategy consulting firm, in house strategy team or Investment banking. Experience in energy sector is advantageous.
Strong quant, analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience in financial business analysis and extracting insights in areas of ambiguity.
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentations.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information to senior stakeholders.
Analytical, data driven, critical thinker. Strong interpersonal skills.
Exceptional academic track record.
This role offers a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the strategic direction of a leading energy company, making a real impact on both current operations and future growth.

We're partnering with an Australian Big 4 bank who are delivering a series of risk uplift and migration initiatives across its eCommerce portfolio. A Product Analyst is required on a 12 month contract to support disciplined delivery, strong governance and clear documentation across these programmes.

This role suits an analyst with early to mid career experience who has worked in regulated digital environments and wants exposure to complex risk and migration work within a large scale organisation.

12 month contract
Sydney based with hybrid working
$690 + super per day
Key responsibilities include:

Leading risk related activities including risk memos, risk assessments and control documentation
Supporting migration and delivery programmes through requirements analysis and coordination
Developing current state and future state process maps and identifying associated risks
Providing structured project and product support across multiple workstreams
Producing clear, concise documentation for senior stakeholders
To be effective in this role you will bring:

2–4 years’ experience as a Product Analyst, Business Analyst or similar role
Background in financial services, digital or eCommerce environments
Sound understanding of risk management and governance practices
Strong written communication and documentation skills
Ability to work confidently with delivery, product and risk stakeholders
If this role is of interest, please apply!

About the Role
We are seeking a Governance Analyst to support Group Finance and Transformation by ensuring accurate reconciliations, robust process documentation, and governance of system changes. This is a highly month-end–focused role, providing key support across multiple divisions and driving consistent financial control and reporting.


Key Responsibilities
Support month-end reconciliations for multiple team members.
Manage and contribute to month-end processes in line with an April financial year.
Reconcile data across multiple systems and review sales reporting variances.
Prepare journal templates and complete journal entries.
Review and enhance system processes to improve accuracy, efficiency, and control.
Collaborate with the business to recommend process improvements.
Support governance over system and process changes, ensuring compliance and accuracy.
Systems & Tools
Experience with SAP, TM1, or IBM Planning Analytics is highly advantageous.
What We’re Looking For
5–7 years’ experience in a finance team environment.
Strong understanding of financial governance, reconciliations, and process documentation.
Experience coordinating with cross-functional teams (Finance, IT, Transformation).
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail.
Effective communication and stakeholder engagement, with the ability to influence without authority.
ERP proficiency and experience with finance transformation projects is desirable.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Information Systems, or related field preferred.
Relevant certifications in governance, risk, or compliance (desirable).
Postgraduate qualifications in finance, analytics, or transformation (desirable). 
Why Join Us
This is an opportunity to be part of a collaborative finance team, driving governance and process excellence across a dynamic Group Finance function.

Apply your Business Analyst expertise within the property industry (this is not an IT role).

Bring proven experience in property, real estate, or asset management analysis.

Must have strong SQL experience and be based in Brisbane or Melbourne CBD.


Who we’re looking for?


Solid experience and understanding of the property industry.

Experience with writing SQL queries.

Degree qualification in accounting and/ or Business-related disciplines or qualification in Business Analysis.

Understanding of Trust Accounting / Real Estate Legislation.

Experience with Management Reporting International (MRI).


The role
We’re seeking a Senior Property Business Analyst to provide expert support to our Business Solutions and Asset Management Services (AMS) teams. You’ll play a key role in managing projects, driving system and process improvements, and supporting change management and client transitions.

Key Responsibilities

Act as an escalation point for complex accounting, system, or user queries.

Partner with technical and business teams to enhance systems and processes.

Identify and implement innovative solutions to strengthen accounting and management services.

Participate in testing and implementation of system fixes, developments, and enhancements.

Proactively respond to changing client needs and identify improvement opportunities.

Manage and support client transitions and mobilisations as required.


About Knight Frank
Knight Frank Australia is part of the world’s largest privately owned property consultancy. We specialise in transactional and advisory services, covering the acquisition, sale, leasing, and management of commercial properties from office buildings and retail spaces to industrial assets.

What’s in it for you?

Flexible leave options – Enjoy two additional weeks of leave, two wellness days each year and the day off on your birthday!

Career growth & recognition – Access to mentorship, leadership programs, and ongoing development & recognition.

Lifestyle perks – Enjoy discounts and rewards through our employee reward platform, The Vault.

Inclusive & community-focused culture – Proud winners of Property Council of Australia Award for Innovation & Excellence Award for Diversity, Equity & Inclusion!

Innovative technology & tools – Work with cutting-edge property platforms and tools.


We value diversity
Different perspectives make us stronger. We welcome people of all genders, cultures, abilities, and experiences.

Important to know

You must have valid Australian working rights to be considered.

A police check is required for successful candidates.

We use AI tools to assist with hiring, but people make the final decisions.

We are currently NOT accepting candidates via an agency, we have PSA’s in place.

We’ve been proudly serving Australian communities since 1914 and have grown to become a top 30-listed company on the ASX with a portfolio of iconic homegrown brands. At the heart of our continued success is over 115,000 team members working across the country, all contributing to bringing our customers smiles. You’ll not only get to see your work make a difference, you’ll be part of a team working together to help Australians eat and live better every day.

About the team

Our Finance team are a vital partner in every aspect of our business, providing commercial insights to drive our success and influence everything we do. With presence in every department, we analyse performance, and deliver actionable insights that shape our strategic decisions.

About the role


As Analytics Manager - Payments, you will shape the analytics function, lead a team of analysts, and drive strategies that influence key business decisions. You’ll ensure data needs are met across projects and deliver insights that enhance operational and commercial outcomes. Your key responsibilities include:



Lead and mentor a team of analysts to deliver high-quality reporting and insights.
Develop and implement strategies for data analysis, reporting, and monetisation.
Define metrics and data sources to support forecasting and reconciliation of complex transactions and fees.
Build strong engagement with brand partners to deliver a best-in-class payments data platform.
Oversee analytics operations to ensure accuracy, quality, and timely delivery.
Transform raw data into actionable insights through effective reporting systems.
Partner across projects to ensure business data requirements are met.
Provide detailed analysis to support business cases and commercial negotiations.
Monitor KPIs, identify trends, and explain variances to drive performance improvements.
Apply industry knowledge to interpret data and optimise outcomes.


About you and your skills


We’re seeking an experienced analytics professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and brings a strategic mindset to data-driven decision making. You will bring:



Proven experience in analytics or business insights, ideally within Financial Services.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels.
Influencing skills to navigate complex internal and external environments.
Ability to engage with senior stakeholders, including C-level executives and regulators.
Demonstrated success in leading and managing data projects.
Advanced analytical and problem-solving capabilities with a strategic outlook.
Knowledge and experience in AI and how we apply in data assets would be advantageous.
Proficiency in analytical and BI tools (Power BI preferred).
Expert-level Excel skills and strong Microsoft Suite proficiency.
A naturally curious mindset with the confidence to challenge existing practices.

What’s in it for you?

Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

Job ID: 174390

Employment Type: Full time


#LI-RM1

Lead Data Engineer
(Initial 12 month FTC - With a view to turn perm)
Greenfield Microsoft Fabric Build. Reporting to CIO

A leading organisation is standing up a brand new Data and Analytics function. This is a rare greenfield opportunity for a Data Engineer who wants to shape an entire ecosystem from day one.

You will work directly with the CIO. You will own the design, build, and evolution of a modern Azure and Microsoft Fabric environment. The strategy is already mapped. Now they need someone with the technical strength and business mindset to bring it to life.

This role suits someone who thrives in autonomy, sees the commercial value of data, and enjoys being the expert in the room.


What you will be doing
Build scalable data pipelines and models across Azure, Fabric and enterprise systems.
Integrate core operational platforms. Salesforce, JD Edwards, SiteTracker and others.
Shape the data architecture. Create models that support high-quality reporting and analytics.
Automate workflows using Python, SQL and REST APIs.
Lift data governance, quality and documentation as foundational pillars of the function.
Partner with senior stakeholders and translate business needs into practical technical outcomes.
Evaluate and introduce modern tooling to accelerate analytics maturity.
Support early Power BI development.
AI-Ready by Design

The foundations you build must be future-proof. The business is already experimenting with Microsoft Copilot and has an AI specialist in-house. The long-term vision is for data engineering and applied AI to merge. Your architecture choices today will enable automation, decision-intelligence and ML-driven workflows tomorrow.


What makes this role exciting
Greenfield environment. You build the blueprint.
Direct line to the CIO.
First hire into a brand new Data and Analytics function.
High likelihood of converting to permanent.
Strong, people-first culture.
Clear path toward an AI-enabled operating model.
What you bring
Experience across Azure, Fabric and modern cloud architectures.
At least six months in a live Microsoft Fabric environment.
Expertise across data modelling, dimensional modelling and scalable architecture.
Python, SQL and REST API capability.
Commercial thinking. Ability to engage senior stakeholders cleanly.
Curiosity around AI and how strong data foundations enable intelligent automation.
Ideally coming from a digital infrastructure or telecommunications infrastructure background
Why this role matters

This hire will determine how the organisation uses data for years to come. You will shape everything. Pipelines. Models. Governance. Architecture. AI-readiness.

If you want to step into a role where you influence, build and own a modern, AI-ready data environment from scratch. This is it.


Apply

Click Apply Now to send your CV directly to Chipo R, Senior Recruiter - Specialist in Data Science and AI talent at Talenza.

Location: Castlemaine, Bendigo, Goldfields & Macedon Ranges VIC
Ad Text:
Position Title: Business Analyst            

Classification: HS5            

Salary per hour: $46.99 + superannuation + generous salary packaging options

Employment Type: Ongoing full-time

Award: Health and Allied Services, Managers and Administrative Workers (Victorian Public Sector) (Single Interest Employers) Enterprise Agreement 2021-2025

 

Role description

Dhelkaya Health is seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join our Finance Directorate and play a critical role in driving informed decision-making across the organisation.

In this pivotal position, you will:

Deliver high-quality financial analysis and activity insights
Develop business cases and financial models to support sustainability and performance
Enhance organisational capability in performance reporting, budget development, and activity-based funding
Support grants management and continuous improvement in financial systems and processes

 

About you

Tertiary qualifications in Accounting, Finance, Commerce, Data Analytics or related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Previous experience in a similar role

 

Culture and Benefits

Dhelkaya Health is located on Dja Dja Wurrung country in regional Victoria. Just a short drive from Bendigo and easily accessed via public transport, the area is brimming with culture that blends the old with the new. Steeped in rich history, the town boasts a vibrant arts scene, historic architecture and is part of the Bendigo Region UNESCO City of Gastronomy. 

Surrounded by scenic trails and a unique natural environment that includes historic goldfields, outdoor enthusiasts can immerse themselves in the beauty of the natural world. Combined with a wide range of sporting clubs and outdoor recreation opportunities, the community offers a rich, diverse culture to enjoy.

From community events celebrating local festivals to grassroots initiatives fostering inclusivity and diversity, this is a place where people come together. At Dhelkaya Health, you'll enjoy all this and a flexible work environment with access to career development pathways that suit your life goals. You'll also benefit from:



Stress-free parking: at no-cost close to your place of work. 
Salary packaging: to maximise your earnings with options to package meals, entertainment, rent/mortgage repayments, and more. 
Healthy and active lifestyle: through access to a free onsite gym and Fitness Passport membership for your family to use in a wide range of gyms, pools, and fitness facilities across the region
Health and wellbeing: through a supported work environment that prioritises work-life balance and a health and well-being program that includes an Employee Assistance Program.
Building meaningful connections: through the Dhelkaya Health Social Club and a variety of staff events and activities throughout the year held in a friendly, inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome.
Home share - If lack of housing is stopping you from applying for a job here, consider Home share. It may help you get started at Dhelkaya Health. See this link for obligation free information.

https://dhelkayahealth.org.au/homeshare/

*All appointments are subject to a satisfactory police check, NDIS (if required) and compliance with Dhelkaya Health Vaccination Policy.

 

Our purpose and role at Dhelkaya Health is to be Healthier Together - we engage and empower individuals and community through the provision of empathetic inclusive and professional health services.  We want a workforce who share our passion and purpose and is as diverse as the communities we serve. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people with a disability, and people of diverse genders and/or sexual orientations.

 

For further information about this position, please contact Catherine Gaskell - Executive Director Finance on 03 5471 3393

 

How to apply

Click here to apply for this role. Please note that candidates are required to submit a cover letter and CV together with a document addressing the key selection criteria (which can be found on the Position Description). Only candidates that supply this information will be considered for roles at Dhelkaya Health.

Job Title: Business Analyst - HCM, 12 Month fixed term engagement
Ad Text:
Leading ASX-listed Services company requires an experienced Business Analyst to join their team and play a key role in the implementation and ongoing optimisation of their Human Capital Management (HCM) system and processes on a 12 month fixed term engagement.

In this role, you will work closely with a broad range of stakeholders to understand business needs, translate requirements into clear solutions, and ensure the successful delivery of HCM initiatives that support our people and business objectives.

On a day-to-day basis, you will:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, document and analyse requirements related to the HCM system.
Act as a trusted bridge between technical teams and business units, ensuring solutions align with strategic goals.
Facilitate workshops and stakeholder meetings to elicit, validate and prioritise requirements.
Produce high-quality documentation, including business process models, functional specifications and use cases.
Support the implementation, testing and deployment of HCM solutions, ensuring a smooth and effective transition.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and provide practical, value-driven recommendations.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging HCM technologies.
To be successful in this role, you will bring:

Proven experience working as a Business Analyst, ideally within an HCM or HR systems environment.
Strong knowledge of leading HCM platforms such as Workday, SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM Cloud, or similar.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail.
Outstanding communication and stakeholder management capabilities.
Experience using business process modelling tools and methodologies.
A solid understanding of HR processes, including payroll, recruitment, talent management and the employee lifecycle.
Desirable

Relevant certifications such as CBAP or HCM product-specific certifications.
A hybrid work environment consisting of 3 days in the office, 2 days from home, is on offer.

Public transport, consisting of buses and metro is only a 5 mins walk away.

Please call Patrick Egan @ TalentWeb on 0407 261 441 for a Confidential Discussion or hit the apply button below.

Camden Council is one of Australia’s fastest-growing local government areas, delivering major digital and data modernisation initiatives to support a thriving and connected community.

With significant investment in Azure cloud capabilities, the Council is building a scalable, modern data platform to enable high-quality analytics and evidence-based decision making.

We are excited to partner with Camden Council to recruit an experienced Senior Data Engineer who will play a pivotal role in driving this transformation.

The Opportunity

As the Senior Data Engineer, you will be a key technical lead within the Digital Technology & Innovation Branch, responsible for architecting and delivering end-to-end data solutions across Camden Council’s Azure environment.

This is a hands-on role where you will design, develop, and optimise data pipelines, establish best-practice data engineering standards, and enable advanced analytics across the organisation.  You will work closely with the Team Leader – Data & Insights, the CIO, and cross-functional stakeholders to build a sustainable and scalable data ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities
Design, build, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
Transform raw data into high-quality, structured assets using Azure Databricks, PySpark, Delta Lake, and Spark SQL.
Manage data across Bronze, Silver, Gold layers in Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2.
Develop and optimise data models to support analytics and Power BI reporting.
Enable advanced analytics by delivering clean, reliable, production-ready datasets.
Implement CI/CD pipelines and Git-based development practices.
Uphold data governance, including cataloging and lineage through Azure Purview/Unity Catalog.
Partner closely with business units to translate requirements into scalable data solutions.
Support platform optimisation, performance tuning, and cost management.
About You

You’re an experienced Senior Data Engineer who thrives in cloud-native environments and enjoys building enterprise-scale data solutions from the ground up.  You will bring:

5+ years’ experience in data engineering, including ETL/ELT, data modelling, and Azure data architecture.
Hands-on experience with Azure Databricks (PySpark, Spark SQL, Delta Lake).
Strong expertise in Azure Data Factory and orchestrating end-to-end pipelines.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience integrating data from APIs, on-prem databases, and CSV/JSON files.
Familiarity with Azure Purview/Unity Catalog and data governance frameworks.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Git-based workflows.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Desirable:

Experience with Power BI, Jira, Confluence, or local government systems (Authority, CAMMS).
Why Join Camden Council?
Be at the forefront of Camden’s enterprise data transformation.
Work with modern Azure technologies in a forward-thinking organisation.
Hybrid work model – 3 days onsite in Oran Park.
Supportive leadership, strong team culture, and impactful community-focused work.
Competitive salary and 2-year fixed term security.
Click 'Apply Now' for immediate consideration.
